oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lotz, Johann Albert, attributed
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sofa
Lotz House, sofa
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Victorian scroll back sofa with curved arms and exposed wood frame.

Lotz, a skilled carpenter and German immigrant, created furniture for the home of his Franklin, Tennessee house and for many patrons in the area prior to the Civil War. This sofa, which has long been associated with the home, is thought to be the work of Lotz.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Furniture; Sofas
Walking a Fine Line
